column4: I recorded a 20 mins home movie that I want to put on DVD. How can I create a DVD menu and put my mpeg movie on DVD?
brasero might do what you need
sort of
why do you say sort of?
it's not the official ubuntu repositories, so it's not supported by ubuntu, and you'll occasionally run into issues because of this
but will installing that DEB comprimise my ubuntu security? Because I use ubuntu for netbanking etc
yes
you can't
if you have concernes about security, don't install packages from sources other than the ubuntu repository.  pretty simple
yes thats why Im asking about http://www.getdeb.net/release/2881
check out mandvd
:P
have you installed it from http://www.getdeb.net/release/2881?
i don't use ubuntu
youre in ubuntu but you dont use ubuntu :P interesting :P
right
so then don't
and just use the repos
im not going to. im tryung todiscgui now
you are beating a dead horse at this point. you've been given numerous suggestions to your problem
just install KDE apps, and it'll just work
which KDE apps? :P
the only distro that does line by line auditing of code is openbsd, if you care about that you should be running openbsd instead of anything else
ok
